intro: Archiphysalis kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi archiphysalis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Guangxi region of China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking, compound leaves and showy, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives in the understory. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
